Hi, you’ve reached the office of Dr. Stuart Price. Please note the office will be closed until the twenty fourth. If it’s an emergency please check…
Hi, this is Dr. Stuart Price. I’m getting married, so I’ll be out of the country for two weeks. I’m not sure if I’ll have cell service. If this is a dental emergency please…
I looked into his eyes. They’re not the eyes of a man. The eyes of a coward!
Phil?

Where the hell are you?

Why can’t you just get married in Vegas, like you did last time? It’s so much easier.
Why can’t you just be excited for me? This is my wedding!

I really am.

Hmm?
Put the prescription pad back.

Was this right up against your scrotum?
Yep.

Come on, Stu! It’s killing him!
I don’t care. Honestly, the two of you were barely invited.
Woh!

I consider Alan to be insane.

Um-hmm.
I’m glad you brought that up. Because this is the bachelor party.
What?

That’s bullshit! You can’t just skip out of a bachelor party, Stu.
Do you see that? pointing to his glass of orange juice That’s orange juice with a napkin on top. Do you know why? So nobody roofies me.
Well, I refuse to eat fucking cantaloupe at a bachelor party!
Come on, Stu! Don’t you think you’re over reacting?
No, I don’t. I’m still putting the broken pieces of my psyche back together. And you know what the glue is? Lauren! And I’m not doing anything to screw that up.
Oh, please! You wouldn’t even be with her if it wasn’t for us.
Oh, this will be good!
Stu, think about it. You ended up ditching Melissa and two years later you meet your true soul mate. You take Vegas out of that equation, you would have married a cunt!
sarcastically Oh, it’s okay. No! No! I’m allowed to say it. It’s a bachelor party. Drink up, everybody. Oh wait! There’s no alcohol. I forgot. We’re at a fucking IHOP.
Well, it’s my decision. And it’s final. So, how about a toast?
This sucks! I’m gonna wait in the car.

Yeah. He’s been standing outside by the mail box everyday.
Wow! That rough.
Yeah. I uh…I’m not quite sure he ever left Vegas, you know? He really needs this.

Oh, thanks Phil. My dad pays my rent.
Alan, what the fuck?
You were supposed to delete these! You made a promise
Woh! Woh! Woh! What the hell? I’m not cool with this all! You can’t have these!
Relax, Stu. Nobody ever comes in here.
Total violation of trust!
I guess we don’t do desert anymore. I didn’t get that memo.
Well, I’m sorry darling. I’ll be right back.
Would a cupcake kill you?
Stu would like to invite you to his wedding.
Well only if you’re not busy.
Stu?
Well, maybe the Jonas Brothers are in town.
Nope, they’re in Raleigh, Durham that weekend.
Are you really being serious, Stu? You’re inviting me?
Yeah, why not? It’ll be fun, right?
Phil, are you going?
Of course!
Then it will be fun.
Ah!

It’s my immunizations. It’s the last day I can do it.

I’m a nurse. I’m just not registered.

Just the first time I’ve heard of it. You could have paged me.
So what are you a doctor?

Ever heard of that guy, Doogie Howser?
Yeah.
Well, he turned out to be a gay.
Alan!

Wolfpack only. Find another chair.

You have to realize that in my country we don’t consider dentist to be a real doctor.
Dad!
Okay.
Anyway, I have to go and talk to Teddy about his chello performance tonight.
That was uh…my dad. I’m a stay at home son. We were discussing your wedding gift. He’s sparing no expense.
Oh! That’s so unnecessary.
I’ve been uh…meaning to ask someone, I noticed that this is a fishing village, is there a Long John Silvers on the island?
You know, no, I don’t think so. I’m so sorry.
But we are actually serving some great fresh sea food.
Better than Long John’s?
Yes.
I’ll be the judge of that. Enjoy your evening.
You too.

I admit it. When I first met Stu I was not quite sold. He seemed unattractive. He lacked intelligence and imagination. He was missing the spark you look for in a man. But then I look into Stu’s eyes, he reminded me of my sweet brother, Chio. For those who do not know, Chio is learning disabled and lives in group home.
But Chio loves khao and that’s when I realized, Stu is khao.
What’s khao?

Khao is soft white rice in lukewarm water. It has no taste. Befitted to small babies and very old people. It is nourishment that everyone can digest. The world needs khao, just as the world needs people like Stu.
To my sweet daughter and Stu. Congratulations.

Hey, everybody. Here’s some fun facts. The population of Thailand is sixty three million people. It is twice the size of Wyoming. It’s chief exports are textiles, footwear and rice. Each year, approximately thirteen thousand people are killed in car accidents in Thailand. The climate in Thailand…

Okay. Sorry.

None of you know Stu like I do. Not you! Not you! Not you! Not you! Not nobody knows Stu like I do. No one! I can’t even tell you what we’ve been through, cause we made a pact more important than blood. What I can tell you is this; this is not Stu’s first marriage. I don’t remember shit!
Tracy wasn’t feeling well, she came down to get me. Wait a second, is Teddy with you guys?

Monkey, taste it. What do you think? Is this shitake?

He just did! Why is he pulling on it?

What the fuck, man? Tell that gay monkey to leave my shit alone!
Chow?
Chow, what the fuck are you doing here?
Alan, called me a few days ago and invited me to wedding.
Excuse me?
What? He’s my plus one.
You didn’t have a plus one. It’s two hundred dollars a plate!

You guys texted me. Said you fucked up and looking to party!
I picked you up in my boat and I brought you here to Bangkok. And we had a sick night, bitches!

Do you know how I got this tattoo?
Uh…yeah! From a fucking tattoo guy! Come on, Stuey! Use the big Jewish brain.

Teddy not dead. He party with us all night!

Okay. Okay. I explain it all, okay? Just let me do one bump. Get my head straight.
Come to papa. Okay.
That’s a big…
You ready for craziest fucking story ever….
I can’t believe this is happening again!
Okay. Look, we’ll handle this. You get back there. You tell them that Alan and I got drunk with him, we’re still partying. You gotta go get married.
No! No! I’m not going back without Teddy. It’s Laura’s little brother, he’s lost! He’s injured! If I fuck this up, I lose everything.
Okay. Alright.
Phil I really think we should go to the American Consulate.
For what? Report a dead body who was shoved into an ice machine?
Well, what are we gonna do? Keep walking around in circles? Cause that real productive!

And all we’ve done is buy him a hats and sodas.

He knows something! He’s wearing Teddy’s sweatshirt. What if just doesn’t understand? Uh…I’ll…I’ll act it out. Yeah! Like charades. Watch.

American teenager in Asia.
Karate Kid with Jaden Smith. It’s easy cause you’re talking through it.

That’s when the cops arrived. Started cracking skulls. I took you guys and hid you in the shop here.

Then you decided to get a tattoo. Cried like a little bitch.  pointing to the kid sat in the tattoo chair

When the monkey nibbles on a penis, it’s funny in any language.
Late last night, you climbed the walls of our monastery. Shouting out question about love, marriage, and the meaning of life. Poor brother Han was meditating alone in the garden and you took him.
Oh, my God! We kidnapped a monk!
Uh…we live an alternative life style.

Brother Han took a vow of silence many years ago. It will be useless to try.

Alan!
I’m afraid fatty is right.

The Buddha believe every memory lives somewhere deep within. Perhaps you should bring your question to the garden of meditation.

No, he said he’s farting because of his medication.

Two thousand dollars.

No! No! No! No! Sorry, you misunderstood. We’re looking for our friend, sixteen years old. Teddy?
Teddy? Yeah he was with you guys last night.

slowly ‘Hello’.
‘Hello’.
‘Hello’.

Don’t be sad, Stu. You love it. You were crying. Saying how special it was.

laughing What a baby! He was crying!
You should have seen him. He was so sexy. The way he move round. But I asked him slow down cause I drop my load to quick.

We’ll see.
Who are you?

I’m a business man. And I have invested a large chunk of capital in your friend, Chow. And in return he was supposed to transfer our profits electronically about five fucking minutes ago. So last night we took Teddy as insurance.
Oh, my God! Is he okay?
We’re fucked. Chow’s dead. What do we do now?

The guy doesn’t give a shit about Chow, Stu! This whole thing is about a fucking bank account. Let’s just go back to the hotel and we’ll search Chow’s body. Hopefully the password’s in his wallet or something.

Just relax. We have until eight a.m. tomorrow to figure it out.
First the monkey, now my hat. How much worse can this day get?

Well, we’re living here in Alan Town, and he’s driven our lives into the ground. When we woke up we were wasted and drunk. Phil got shot, we got beaten by a monk. I was happy and my life was good. Gettin’ married like a dentist should. Roasting marshmallows on a stick. I got fucked in the ass by a girl with a dick.
Ha, ha, I remember that!
And we’re living here in Alan town. But they’re taking Teddy’s finger now. And I’m pretty sure I’m gonna lose my shit, and shoot Alan in the face, and shoot myself.
You totally butchered that song.
You totally butchered my life.
You all right? You warm enough?
I don’t know. Come feel my balls and tell me. I’ve been locked in a fucking icebox all day.
Chow, nobody killed you. You were already dead. You didn’t have pulse.
Oh, you never do blow before? Sometime your heart stop, start up again. Read a book.
Look, I’m sorry. We’re just having a bad day.
Oh, you having a bad day? Did you die?
I got shot.

Who is that fucking guy, anyway?
Invest in my business.

They shot the monkey! They shot the monkey! I’m at my wits end!
Everybody all right?
Yeah!
I have such an erection right now!
Are you for real?
You’re cigarettes. I got ’em right here. Here you go.
There you go. Deep breath. Good. Good. Smoke it in. Breath the smoke into your tiny little lungs. There you go. It’s funny, I’ve never been much of a smoker. But, boy, does it look cool on you.
I’m going to miss you monkey. I wish monkeys could Skype. Maybe one day.
You ever do anything that doesn’t end up in a standoff, Chow?
I’m an international criminal. It always ends like this. I met my wife at one of these things.
You have a wife?

No. That…that’s cool.
Password?
Belloni one.

Yes. This sting operation has been in place for weeks. When Samir told us that your friend was lost, we took advantage of that information. I’m sorry.

So can Teddy come out of the car now?
No, Alan. Teddy’s not in the fucking car!
They don’t have him. They never had him. They just needed us to bring them Chow. They used Teddy as bait.

No. We’ve checked everywhere. No one has seen him. I’m sorry. If you haven’t found him by now, I’m afraid Bangkok has him.

So what?

Stu?

I want you to call Doug, tell him I’m never coming back. Getting off the hamster wheel and stay here in Bangkok. I think I belong here. Open up a little dentist office. Teeth cleanings with a happing ending.
Listen Teddy. I’m really sorry. We didn’t mean for any of this to happen.

Bangkok.

Yeah! Right? Fucking Bangkok! You said, I’m a joke. Well, I’m not. I’m not some weird milky, ricey, watery goop that you feed infants and old people. Okay? Maybe, I would be if you added some cayenne pepper! I wish I was a boring dentist, who had boring life and boring friends. But I don’t! I’m not! I’m actually part of this weird wolfpack.

Woh! Here’s the deal, man. I got a dark side.
It’s true. He has semen in him.
I said, demon.
But you also have semen in you, remember?
Not relevant. But thank you, Alan.

The point is, this demon takes me to pretty weird places. Now we lost Teddy for two days in Bangkok. But that same demon, took us to hell and back to find him. We took on Bangkok and we won. Now that’s pretty fucking cool, if you ask me! Right?
I love your daughter and I’m gonna marry her.
Unless you have any problem with that?
I’m good.
All right. But all that said, it would actually mean a great deal to both of us, if we could just give your mother fucking blessing!
